responses: My name is Trek, I am an AI based chatbot, I can help you to get details about various tourism places in andaman.

patterns: About andaman
Tell me about andaman
port blair
where is andaman located
Andaman and Nicobar Islands
Why should I visit andaman
responses: The Andaman and Nicobar Islands, located in the east of the Indian mainland geographically, float in splendid isolation in the Bay of Bengal. Once a hill range extending from Myanmar to Indonesia, these picturesque undulating islands, islets numbering around 836, are covered with dense rain-fed, damp and evergreen forests and endless varieties of exotic flora and fauna. Most of these islands (about 550) are in the Andaman Group, 28 of which are inhabited. The smaller Nicobars, comprise some 22 main islands (10 inhabited). The Andaman and Nicobars are separated by the Ten Degree Channel which is 150 Kms. wide.

The Andaman Islands are an Indian archipelago in the Bay of Bengal.There are roughly 300 islands in Andaman which are known for their palm-lined, white-sand beaches, mangroves and tropical rainforests. Coral reefs supporting marine life such as sharks and rays make for popular diving and snorkeling sites. Indigenous Andaman Islanders inhabit the more remote islands, many of which are off limits to visitors.

patterns: Best time to visit andaman ?
What is the best time to visit Andaman?
when to visit andaman and nicobar islands
Best season to visit
responses: The best time to visit Andaman & Nicobar Islands is considered between October and May as the weather is pleasant, just perfect for sightseeing, water sports, and beach excursion. Monsoons (July to September) are not always recommended because of the high tidal waves, incessant rains and strong winds.

patterns: How to reach Andaman ?
Ways to visit andaman
Destination to andaman
Flights to andaman
ships to andaman
responses: The airport at Port Blair is well connected to all major cities of India. Ships are available from Kolkata, Vizag and Chennai but tickets must be booked in advance. Since a 3-day journey is exhausting, prefer flights as they are the more convenient option.

Being an island, Andaman is connected with India through sea and air routes only. The airport is located at Port Blair and there are direct flights from Kolkata, Chennai and Vishakhapatnam. Air India, Jet Airways, Go Air and Spice Jet airlines offer their services here.

patterns: What documents are required for foreign nationals traveling to Andaman?
documnets should be bought by foreigners to visit andaman
identity cards should be bought by foreigners
responses: Foreigners are required to carry their passport with a valid Indian visa. Restricted Area Permit will be issued at the airport or port, valid for 30 days, and can be extended for further 15 days upon expiry. There will be no further extensions. You need to go back to any Indian city and board flight again if you wish to explore Andaman.

patterns: Do Indians need a passport to visit Andaman?
documnets should be bought by indians to visit andaman
identity cards should be bought by indians
responses: Indians do not require a passport to visit Andaman, only a valid adhar card is enough.

patterns: What is the currency in Andaman?
Where should I get my currency exchanged?
currency in Andaman
responses: Indian rupee is the currency used in Andaman. It is Preferable to carry cash with you as ATMs are only available at Port Blair and Havelock islands. The facility for exchange of currency is only available in Port Blair. Credit cards are only acceptable in big hotels and resorts.

patterns: What are the local transport options in Andaman?
how can I transport from one location to other in andaman
what type of travel options are available?
responses:
Though you can get rickshaws or auto rides, it is better to hire a prepaid taxi. Taxis are also included in tour packages. for inter island, There are private and government ferries which connects Port Blair to other major islands. Tickets for Private ferries easily available in advance from local agents or directly from the company office as compared to government Ferries as for this ticket is available only at the Jetty counter on first come first served basis.
You can hire a bicycle on a daily basis at Port Blair and Havelock. Carry a license and helmet if you wish to hire a bike. There are no petrol stations and the fuel is sold in cans. If on a shoestring budget, you can travel by bus from Port Blair to Northern Andaman.

patterns: What are the food options in Andaman?
about food in andaman
variety of foods in andaman
What kind of food is popular in Andaman and Nicobar?
port blair special foods
what kind of food is available to eat in andaman
responses: Being an island, it is a heaven for seafood lovers. Besides that, a variety of Indian and continental food is also available. Finding vegetarian food in Andaman will not be a hassle.

The staple diet of Andaman includes rice, coconut, spices, and lots of seafood. In fact, being a group of islands, Andaman is a paradise for seafood lovers. From cuttlefish, crabs, lobsters, prawns, to the all-time favorite Red Snapper, you can taste a variety of seafood on these islands.

patterns: Is veg available in Andaman?
About vegetarian food in andaman
responses: When you think about beaches in Andaman, the next thing that comes to your mind are the delicious seafood cuisine that is available on the islands. So, we can easily call this place a heaven for non-vegetarians. If you are a hardcore vegetarian, who prefers only to eat from places that cook vegetarian food in Andaman. It becomes a little difficult task. Still you find some pure veg restaurants .

patterns: What kind of clothes to wear in Andaman?
What type of clothes are weared in Andaman?
What to wear on your Andaman Trip
what should i wear in andaman?
responses:
You can wear light cotton clothing, sun dresses, shorts or shirts when sightseeing in Andaman.
Keep hats, caps, sunglasses handy, in order to stay protected under the sun. Bathing suits should be restricted to the beaches only. Dress modestly if you plan to visit any religious place.

Cotton is the most preferred material. Wear dresses, which can absorb sweat and dry easily. This helpsto keep you comfortable throughout the trip. Wear cap and sunscreens to avoid the harsh face of the sun.

patterns: How many days are sufficient for Andaman?
how many days it will take to cover whole andaman
days needed or required to complete andaman tour
responses: A 6 Nights and 7 Days trip is best to cover all the main sightseeing activities. A 9 Nights and 10 Days will give you to time to explore all islands and activities at a leisure.

A 7-8 Days trip is enough to cover the main popular sightseeing but, but if you really want to explore it completely and wanna take buckets of beatuifull memories then At least 10-13 days will be suggestive to take in all the beauty in Andaman.

patterns: Which languages are generally spoken in the Andamans?
Most Spoken Languages In Andaman And Nicobar Islands?
language should be known for visiting andaman
what is main language of andaman
responses: The most widely spoken language on the islands is Bengali followed by Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam. Andaman Creole Hindi is also widely used as a trade language in the Andaman islands.
Bengali, Tamil, Malayalam, Hindi, and English are the main languages spoken in the Andamans

Most of the people speak know hindi and bengali (specially in North and Middle Andaman) However, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam are also common in Andaman & Nicobar island. The habitants of the Andaman Islands have Andamanese which is a small group that speak Andamanese language as same as some groups of habitants speak Nicobari
You would see lot of Bengali, Telugu and Tamil peoples there in Andaman and Hindi, English and Bengali are generally spoken for communication.

patterns: Is it safe to visit  Andaman and nicobar Islands?
is it safe to visit Andaman Islands?
How safe is Andaman Islands
responses: Andaman is plenty safe. However, gaining some practical knowledge about the place is essential to be meticulous about the worst-case scenarios.
With a very low crime rate, Andaman is extremely safe and peaceful. Also, there have been no reports of communal violence.

Andaman is a safe place to visit. The locals are friendly and help tourists as much as they can. There are no specific areas which are unsafe, however, it is always advisable to take precautions and not leave your belongings unguarded. Petty thefts do occur but they are not common.
Andaman is absolutly safe area. It is having minimal crime which is negligible, People of Andaman live in peace environment and simple life.

patterns: How much does a Andaman trip cost?
Is Andaman Islands a budget friendly place?
what is the cost for visiting andaman
how much it will cost to visit andaman
cost to visit andaman
responses: Andaman is comparatively cheaper then some of the competitive Tourist Destination, The cost of your Andaman package is calculated based on the place you visit, the hotel you choose, and the number of persons traveling.

If you are visiting with family, your per-person cost would be less than a couple on the same tour package. This is because the family will be sharing a vehicle where the cost is split between the people.
On an average a package for 7 Nights and above can cost you around Rupees 11,000 including foods, travelling and ticketing (Andaman Airport-Airport).

Andaman has a lot to offer for all kinds of travelers. If you are planning on a budget trip then you will find a lot of pocket friendly accommodation options. Do book your flights in advance to save up on those air ticket costs. Cost might add up depending on the type of water sports and activities you partake in.

responses:
All the major water sports are done in Port Blair, Havelock,Neil Island and Jolly buoy.Island is a heaven for water sports and the islands offers some of the most unique water sports that anyone can do in the islands.
Boat riding, snorkeling, undersea walk, jet skiing, scuba diving, kayaking, seaplane rides, swimming in the pristine clear waters are some of the activities can be done in various beaches around andaman

responses: Andaman is known for its popular Radhanagar beaches which is one of the best beaches in the Asia region.If you want to enjoy the calm waters and the sunset over the horizon, this is the place to be. Other popular tourist beaches of Andaman include Elephant beach, Kala Pathar, Wandoor, Corbyn’s Cove, Vijayanagar, Sitapur, Kalipur beach in Diglipur and many more.

patterns: climatic conditions in andaman.
weather Comdition in andaman
Tell me about the climatic conditions in andaman
How will be the weather in andaman
responses:
The islands have a tropical climate. The South-west Monsoon sets in Andaman Nicobar islands towards the end of May and the North-east Monsoon in November. There is no fury of hot summer, no chilling winter, no water clogging or traffic jams. For those who want to enjoy boating, swimming, snorkeling, sightseeing all 12 months is season. North Indians find relief from burning heat and chilling winter if they visit the island from May/June/July and in December/January. Season for nature lovers is May to December when forest is lush green and waterfalls are at their prime. Divers can enjoy the best during December to April and bird watchers during winter times.
For more details: https://www.google.com/search?q=weather+in+andamn&oq=weather+in+andamn

patterns: Tell me about cellular Jail
Why to visit cellular jail
Where is cellular jail located
What is there to see in cellular jail
Activites can be done in cellular jail
cellular Jail
responses:
This three-storeyed prison, constructed by Britishers in 1906, is a pilgrimage destination for freedom fighters.
This colossal edifice has mutely witnessed the most treacherous of inhumane atrocities borne by the convicts, who were mostly freedom fighters. Now dedicated to the nation as a National Memorial.

patterns: Visiting timings for cellular jail
when to visit cellular jail
responses: The saga of the heroic freedom struggle is brought alive in a moving Son-et-Lumiere, shown daily inside the jail compound at 6.00 PM (Hindi) and 7.15 PM (English). Also there is a Museum, an Art gallery, and a Photo gallery, which are open on all days except Monday from 9.00 AM to 12 Noon and 2.00 PM to 5.00 PM.

responses: Corbyns Cove beach- the coconut-palm fringed beach, six kilometers away from Port Blair town is ideal for swimming and sun-basking. Facilities like hotel, restaurant, bar, changing room, adventure water-sports are available here. Historical remains like Japanese Bunkers can be seen on the way to this beach. The Snake Island situated just across the beach is popular for scuba diving.

Chidiya Tapu Beach
responses:
Chidiya tapu is a carpet of rich mangrove forests that host numerous species of birds. This eco-park, at the southernmost tip of the South Andaman Island, is situated at a distance of 28 km from Port Blair, the capital of the archipelago. There are regular bus services from Port Blair to Chidiya tapu.
Apart from being a birdwatching paradise, this place is also popular for its picnic spots, trekking trails and glorious sunset views.
The biological park at Chidiya tapu, with its rich and diverse flora and fauna, is also a must-visit.

There is no entry ticket for visiting Chidiya Tapu Beach.

This place is ideal for all sorts of water activities like Scuba dive, snorkeling and seawalk. Also loved the short walk to reach the Lighthouse. patterns: Tell me about Mount Harriet National Park

Mount Harriet National Park
Mount Manipur
responses:
One of the many national parks in the Andaman Islands is the Mount Harriet National Park, which is considered as the main attraction and highest peak in the Archipelago of South Andaman. The main feature of Mount Harriet is its fauna and natural flora, which are up to now still unmatched. Just like a forest, Mount Harriet is covered with greenery and Port Blair can be seen from the top of the mount’s peak.
It take 15 – 20 minutes by boat from Port Blair to Bamboo flat and another 15 – 20 minutes by road from Bamboo flat to Mount Harriet.

patterns: Tell me about Anthropological Museum

Anthropological Museum
Anthropology museum
responses: Anthropological Museum is one of the best museums in town to visit. It is a well maintained museum which tells us more about this island’s local tribes. These tribes are also believed to be one of the oldest in the world. The islands have six main tribes native to this place, Onges, Sentinelese, Jarawas, Andamanese, Shompens and Nicobarese. These tribes maintain limited contact with the world, and not a lot is known about them.

patterns: Visiting timings for Anthropological Museum

patterns: Tell me about Ross Island
Why to visit Ross Island
Where is Ross Island located
What is there to see in Ross Island
Activites can be done in Ross Island
Ross Island
responses:
Ross Island is a beautiful destination to visit when in Andaman and Nicobar Islands. This is a lovely place to tour if you want to make a day out it by traversing for hours amidst its historical importance. Ross Island was the headquarters of the British colony and today it houses its ruins of the buildings that were built during the British time. The Islands century old trees have captured few important landmarks by its wild vines, roots, and trunks like the Officers Quarters and rundown Church of the British times.
Ross Island also offers a light and sound show on all days excluding Wednesdays and public holidays. The light and sound show depicts the island’s historical events that happened during the pre-independent era, set up of the first administrative settlement and insight about various other historical events that took place on the islands.

patterns: Visiting timings for Ross Island
when to visit Ross Island
Entry ticket price for Ross Island
responses:
Boats for Ross and North bay are available at Phoenix bay jetty,Port Blair by 7.00am.
There are plenty of ferry ride from Marine Park, Port Blair. To cover the entire Island in a day, it is wise to take a ferry in the morning and return back in the afternoon because the ferries run from 7 am to 3 pm.
And cost for visiting ross island is around 300Rs per head in a private ferry orelse if you go with government ferry it will cost nearly 5Rs per head.

patterns: Tell me about light and sound show at Ross Island
Why to visit light and sound ross island
Light and sound show at ross island
what is light and sound at ross
Light and sound at ross island
light and sound ross island
Visiting timings for light and sound at Ross Island
when to visit for light and sound at Ross Island
Ticket price for light and sound at Ross Island
responses:
Ross Island also offers a light and sound show on all days excluding Wednesdays and public holidays. The light and sound show depicts the island’s historical events that happened during the pre-independent era, set up of the first administrative settlement and insight about various other historical events that took place on the islands.
This show thrills its audience with great lighting and music that is used to display the struggle of the freedom fighters and the life of the British administrators in this Island takes them back in time.
The show commences around 5.15 PM (depending on Sunset time), for which a boat has to be boarded 4 PM sharp at Rajiv Gandhi Water Sports Complex and the destination will be reached in 15 minutes of the boat ride.
Entry fee: Adult- Rs. 250/- (inclusive of Boat tickets, entry fee to Ross Island and show charges), Children (5 to 12 Years)- Rs. 150/- (inclusive of Boat tickets, entry fee to Ross Island and show charges).
